DataElement.preferredDefinition: A rule(s) different than those previously specified which guides the generation a approved diagnostic, therapeutic, and/or research image.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity._A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data._Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

Concepts.definition: A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.:Requirement; something that is necessary.

Concepts.definition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/7/13 DEC releaed. jc  10/4/13 Created post Rnd 4 community comments; supercedes DEC 2717438 - generalized from PET to Equipment.   jc

ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.
